it.cnr.isti.hpc.dexter.spotter

Interface Spotter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSpotter, DictionarySpotter, NifSpotter

    public interface Spotter
    Spotting aims at identifying spots, i.e., contiguous sequences of n terms (n-grams) occurring in a document D that might mention some entity e.

    Each spot is associated with a set of candidate entities C, that could be represented by the spot.
    Author:
    Diego Ceccarelli

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • match

        SpotMatchList match(DexterLocalParams localParams,
                    it.cnr.isti.hpc.dexter.common.Document document)
        Given a document a Spotter identifies all the fragments that could be referring to an entity. It returns a list of Spots, i.e. mentions ( SpotMatchList) each one associated with a set of candidate entities C, that could be represented by the spot.
        Parameters:
        dexterParams - the global params of the project.
        localParams - contains particular parameters set for this query, can be null.
        sml - the list of spots detected in a document, each spot match contains a list of candidate entities.
        Returns:
        a list of spots, each one associated with a set of candidate entities C, that could be represented by the spot.

      • init

        void init(DexterParams dexterParams,
          DexterLocalParams defaultModuleParams)
        Initializes the Spotter with the global params
        Parameters:
        dexterParams - the global params of the project.
        defaultModuleParams - the module init params

      • setFilters

        void setFilters(java.util.List<SpotMatchFilter> filters)
        Set the filter to apply to the spots after the spotting.

      • filter

        SpotMatchList filter(DexterLocalParams params,
                     SpotMatchList sml)
        Removes the SpotMatch based on the filters.
        Parameters:
        sml - the SpotMatchList to filter, at the end of the function the list is modified.
        Returns:
        the SpotMatchList filtered.
